snippet: Getting the blame for gridlock has prompted a different approach for some candidates as Election Day draws near.
abstract: Getting the blame for gridlock is prompting some Republican Congressional candidates to embrace bipartisanship as a campaign theme; Republicans in tough races are seeking to soften their edges by moderating their votes, shaking off their Tea Party label and projecting a conciliatory image to voters in ads.

byline.original: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER and JONATHAN WEISMAN

lead_paragraph: Getting the blame for gridlock has prompted a different approach for some candidates as Election Day draws near.

headline.main: Some Republicans Try Out a New Campaign Theme: Bipartisanship
headline.print_headline: Some Republicans Try Out a New Campaign Theme: Bipartisanship
